Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dracut
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: dracut bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The dracut packages include an event-driven initial RAM file system (initramfs) generator infrastructure based on the udev device manager. The virtual file system, initramfs, is loaded together with the kernel at boot time and initializes the system, so it can read and boot from the root partition. This update fixes the following bugs: In the initramfs, the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) client script for renewing leases did not update the lifetime of the IPv4 address. As a consequence, the IPv4 address could expire for very short lifetime settings, and the network connection failed. Now, the new DHCP client script updates the IPv4 address lifetime. (BZ#1144277) If the DHCP server did not provide an IPv4 address lifetime, the DHCP client script in the initramfs did not set up the network correctly. Consequently, there was no network connection in the initramfs. Now, IPv4 address lifetime information is handled correctly. (BZ#1144914) Due to a bug, the initramfs exited after a successful download of a live image, and the download of the live image was retried for every network interface. Now, the script only exits on error, and the live image is downloaded only once. (BZ#1152485) The fstab file in the kdump initramfs contained the file system check flag for NFS mount points. As a consequence, the fsck flag for the NFS mount points was tried without any consequences. This has been fixed. (BZ#1186699) The iSCSI connection script did not wait for all interfaces to be up before connecting to the iSCSI targets in the initramfs. As a consequence, a connection timeout for the iSCSI targets occurred, and the system boot took an excessive amount of time. Now, the script in the initramfs waits for all interfaces to come up before trying to connect to iSCSI targets. (BZ#1189891) The hyperv_keyboard kernel module was not included in the initramfs. Consequently, the user could not enter the password for encrypted disks on Hyper-V Gen2 virtual machines. The hyperv_keyboard kernel module is now included in the initramfs. (BZ#1194529) Long-lasting modprobes could be killed in the initramfs if the initramfs switched root. As a consequence, the actions of the modprobe scripts were canceled. Now, the initramfs waits for any udev events to be finished before switching root. (BZ#1231373) Network interfaces were configured on "add" and "change" udev events. Consequently, the default gateway was lost in the process. With this update, the default gateway setup is no longer lost. (BZ#1238043) Due to bugs in the initramfs network setup functions, a duplicate IP address was assigned to an interface without a link connection. As a consequence, the installer set up this configuration as the default configuration. Now, no IP addresses are assigned to network interfaces without a carrier link. (BZ#1249507) When starting the Red Hat Enterprise Linux installation and appending the "ip=ibft" installation option on the kernel command line, the installation failed early and entered dracut emergency mode. Now, installation no longer fails. (BZ#1256814) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: With this update, it is indicated that a duplicate IPv4 address was specified and it is not assigned to other interfaces, which prevents problems with duplicate IP addresses during installation from occurring. (BZ#1202553) This update adds a number of cryptographic kernel modules that load on an IBM System z machine if started in FIPS mode, and ensure that the machine satisfies FIPS requirements. (BZ#1215766) This update adds a kernel command-line argument to bind an IP to a network interface with a specified MAC address. As a result, dracut now supports specifying the network interface name with "enx[MAC]" in the "ip=" argument. (BZ#1241102) Users of dracut are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
